business.headline: Reliance AGM: Why shares dropped over 2% despite Jio IPO buzz and AI pushAddressing shareholders, Mukesh Ambani promised that Jio has the potential to deliver value comparable to global leaders and called the IPO an "attractive opportunity" for investors.

Reliance teams up with Meta to bring enterprise AI solutions to IndiaThe joint venture will create AI platforms and tools based on Meta's open-source Llama models. These will be designed to help businesses improve efficiency across areas like customer service, sales, IT operations, finance, and more.
Sensex closes 271 points lower, Nifty below 24,500; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 270.92 points to close at 79,809.65, while the NSE Nifty lost 74.05 points to end at 24,426.85.

Jio IPO likely to make Dalal Street debut by 1st half of 2026Jio IPO: The announcement was made by Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani in his address to investors at the conglomerate's 48th Annual General Meeting (AGM).

Rupee falls to all-time low of 87.97 amid US tariff concernsA weaker rupee against the yuan could offer a partial cushion for exporters hit by US tariffs, making Indian products relatively cheaper compared to Chinese rivals. It could also help narrow India's trade deficit with China.

Reliance AGM 2025: Will Mukesh Ambani announce Jio IPO?The main talking point at the Reliance AGM will be information about the much-awaited initial public offerings (IPOs) of Jio Platforms and Reliance Retail finally get a timeline.

Sanjeev Sanyal hints at major overhaul in EPFO with 3.0 rolloutEconomist Sanjeev Sanyal has signalled that the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) is gearing up for a major transformation, with the much-awaited EPFO 3.0 promising faster, simpler, and more digital-first services.

Trump's draconian tariffs may cost India $55-60 billion, warns Jefferies' Chris WoodChris Wood argues that the US tariffs are as much political as economic. He links the steep duties to Donald Trump's "personal pique" at being denied a role in resolving India-Pakistan tensions after their four-day conflict in May.

Cash-rich but time-poor? Why real wealth is about balance, explains CAIn today's fast-paced world, people often chase bigger salaries and titles, but an expert says money alone cannot define wealth. What matters more, he argues, is the freedom to spend time on things that truly count.

Will 50% US tariffs hit India's economic growth in Q1 and beyond?US tariffs, slow private investment, and weak urban demand are testing India's growth. Can GST cuts, government spending, and a strong monsoon keep the economy from stalling?

Reliance AGM today: 5 things you need to knowAll eyes will be on Reliance Industries as it holds its 48th AGM today at 2 PM. From Jio and retail IPO buzz to its push into green energy and AI, investors are bracing for big announcements from Mukesh Ambani.

Former RBI governor Urjit Patel appointed IMF executive directorUrjit Patel succeeds K. Subramanian and will represent India, along with neighbouring countries including Bangladesh, Bhutan, and Sri Lanka, at the Washington-based global financial institution.

Sensex, Nifty open higher after two-day sell-off amid US tariff jittersAt 9:22 am, the S&P BSE Sensex rose 112 points to 80,193.25, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 45 points to 24,545.90. Broader markets also edged higher as volatility eased slightly.

IndiGo gets another six-month extension to lease Turkish Airlines planesThe extension will help IndiGo cut losses caused by geopolitical restrictions, the airline said, referring to an airspace ban imposed by Pakistan on Indian airlines earlier this year that has led to longer routes and higher costs.

India to boost Russian oil imports in September despite US pressure: ReportIndia has become Russia's biggest oil customer since Western sanctions forced Moscow to redirect supplies in 2022. Cheaper Russian crude has helped Indian refiners keep costs down, but the trade has also attracted criticism.

India extends duty-free cotton imports to shield textile sector from US tariffsFor mills, the duty-free extension offers much-needed relief. The earlier exemption, ending in September, was too short to allow large imports, as shipments from exporting nations often take more than a month.

CIBIL Decoded: How delayed credit score updates can hit your loans and ratesA delay of even a few weeks in updating information with the credit bureau can decide whether a person gets a loan, how much interest they pay, or if they are denied altogether.

Sensex drops 1,500 points in two sessions: Will US tariffs keep hitting D-Street?Dalal Street remains volatile as global trade tensions collide with domestic pressures. Investors face uncertainty, with heavyweights under pressure, mid- and small-caps slipping, while cautious buying emerges at key support levels.

More taxes coming from people than companies, finds reportFor the first time, personal income tax collections in India have overtaken corporate tax, signalling a major shift in the country's tax landscape.

GST 2.0: Which states will take the biggest hit if taxes drop?GST 2.0 promises lower taxes and cheaper goods, but the real challenge looms for revenue-dependent states. The question is, who absorbs the shortfall when the proposals come into effect?
Sensex closes 706 points lower; Nifty below 24,600; HCLTech down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 706 points to close at 80,080.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 211.15 points to end at 24,500.90.

India on track to become 2nd largest economy by 2038: ReportWith a combination of a young population, rising domestic consumption, fiscal discipline, and structural reforms, India appears well-positioned to climb the global economic ladder in the coming decades.

Don't miss this step after filing ITR: Here's what to doSimply filing your ITR is not enough. You must verify it within 30 days, else, missing this important step could mean delays, penalties, and even your return being declared invalid.

Why is Trump targeting India with tariffs? Raghuram Rajan explainsFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that US President Donald Trump's decision to impose steep tariffs, including a 50% duty on Indian goods, is part of a wider strategy that goes beyond trade economics.

GST 2.0 boost for textile, fertiliser sectors as Trump's 50% tariff kicks inThe textile and fertiliser industries are expected to be among the biggest beneficiaries of the upcoming GST 2.0 rationalisation amid US President Donald Trump's 50% tariff.

Dividend mismatch with AIS? Here's how taxpayers should report itFiling ITR often becomes confusing when dividend income in your personal records doesn't match what appears in AIS. Here's how to handle it while filing ITR.

Cheaper milk, chocolates, clothes and more: How GST 2.0 could slash your billsThe proposed changes, to be discussed at the Council's meeting on September 3–4 in New Delhi, focus on widening the nil rate, scrapping the 12% slab, and reducing rates on selected 18% goods.

Sensex tanks 600 points: Why is stock market falling today?The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 605.97 points to 80,180.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 173.50 points to 24,538.55, as both the indices continued their downward movement.
Sensex nosedives 600 points, Nifty tumbles as US tariffs hit marketsThe Sensex shed 600 points to close at 81,074, while the Nifty ended below the 24,600 mark after slipping into bearish territory.
High-end electric vehicles likely to attract 18% GSTAccording to the proposals, GST on four-wheeled EVs priced between Rs 20 lakh and Rs 40 lakh will be raised from 5 per cent to 18 per cent.
Chocolates with cocoa, pastries, ice cream likely to be taxed at 5% instead of 18%The proposed rationalisation stems from the Council's broader push to simplify the GST framework.

Condensed milk, dates, jams, mushrooms, namkeens to get cheaper under GST 2.0The fitment committee has proposed that products such as butter, condensed milk, jams, mushrooms, dates, nuts, and namkeens move from the current 12 per cent GST slab to just 5 per cent.

PM SVANidhi scheme extended till 2030, higher loans and credit cards for vendorsThe move is expected to benefit 1.15 crore street vendors, including 50 lakh new beneficiaries. The scheme will continue to be implemented jointly by the Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs (MoHUA) and the Department of Financial Services (DFS).

India eyes new markets amid US tariffs, aims to boost textile, jewellery exportsPlans are being drawn up to explore new markets, increase outreach, and give special attention to sectors such as textiles and gems and jewellery, which are likely to be among the hardest hit by the tariff.
Can a Rs 10,000 monthly SIP make you a crorepati? Here's the timelineCan Rs 10,000 a month really make you a crorepati? The maths of SIPs shows that with discipline and time, the answer is yes.

These 3 banks offer special FDs with higher interest rates till September 2025For those planning to invest in FDs, three banks are running special schemes with better interest rates valid up to September 2025.

How will Trump's 50% tariff impact India's growth?The 50% tariff by the US comes at a time when India has reported strong growth of 6.5% in 2024–25 and has been projected to remain the fastest-growing major economy.

Filing ITR for FY 2024-25? Keep these 6 documents handyKeeping your documents in order is the first step to a smooth filing process. Not having the documents in place not only delays the process but also increases the chance of errors in the return.

Indian crypto platforms boom in grey zone, says Zerodha's Nithin KamathTraders are increasingly drawn to futures and options (F&O) products in digital assets, lured by high leverage and lower tax costs compared to traditional markets.

Trump's 50% tariff shock: How can exporters shield themselvesThe tariff was announced as a response to India's continued trade with Russia, and it now places Indian products at a disadvantage in the American market.

entertainment.headline: Param Sundari review: Sidharth-Janhvi can sell Kerala trips, not loveRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025'Param Sundari' review: Tushar Jalota's romantic comedy starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor delivers stunning Kerala visuals and good music, but lacks chemistry and a compelling story. Yet another predictable and forgettable Bollywood love story.
Zeenat Aman admits she once failed to recognise SabyasachiVeteran actor Zeenat Aman shares a nostalgic encounter with designer Sabyasachi Mukherjee at Mumbai's Taj hotel.

KBC 17: Isro scientist fails to answer Rs 25 lakh question. Can you?In the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati', Amitabh Bachchan welcomed Isro scientist to the hot seat, who quit the game at Rs 25 lakh. Can you answer the answer?

Anthony Ippolito to portray young Sylvester Stallone in biopic I Play RockyActor Anthony Ippolito is set to take on the role of young Sylvester Stallone in 'I Play Rocky'. The film reveals the true underdog story behind the making of the iconic 'Rocky' movie and Stallone's relentless pursuit of his dream.

Param Sundari X reviews: Sidharth-Janhvi shine in a film with weak second halfActors Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor's 'Param Sundari' opens to mixed reactions. Audiences praise the chemistry, but criticise the predictable second half.

Bigg Boss 19: Gauahar reacts after Amaal says Awez-Nagma get work because of himBigg Boss 19 heats up as Amaal Mallik accuses Awez Darbar and Nagma Mirajkar of taking no stand inside the house. Gauahar Khan defends the couple.

Parag Tyagi marks Ganesh Chaturthi in Shefali Jariwala's memory, fulfills her wishParag Tyagi celebrated Ganesh Chaturthi in memory of Shefali Jariwala. He shared a video along with a heartfelt note while remembering his wife.

Bosco Martis demands equal credit for choreographers after Chuttamalle's successChoreographer Bosco Martis has voiced his concerns about inadequate recognition for his work on the hit song 'Chuttamalle' from the Telugu film Devara Part 1.  He called for equal respect and visibility for choreographers alongside stars and music directors in the Indian film industry.

Linkin Park and Playboi Carti to headline Lollapalooza India 2026Lollapalooza India 2026 has announced a historic line-up with Linkin Park set to perform in the country for the first time, alongside headliner Playboi Carti. The Mumbai festival has been scheduled for January 24–25, 2026.

Songs of Paradise review: Saba delivers, Soni Razdan adds soul to Kashmiri sagaRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025'Songs of Paradise' review: Prime Video's latest offering, 'Songs of Paradise', beautifully blends Kashmir's breathtaking landscapes with its rich musical heritage, tracing the inspiring journey of Noor Begum, a woman who defied patriarchy through her voice. Anchored by powerful performances and soulful music, the film is a poignant ode to resilience and art.

Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari teaser: Varun-Janhvi bring love, laughter with twistsThe teaser for Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor's rom-com 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' has been unveiled, promising a festive wedding twist. Directed by Shashank Khaitan, the film will be released in theatres on October 2.

Bugonia trailer: Emma Stone goes bald in Yorgos' sci-fi dark comedyEmma Stone reunites with Yorgos Lanthimos for the sci-fi black comedy 'Bugonia', where she plays a CEO kidnapped by men who believe she's an alien. The trailer, featuring her bold bald look, has gone viral ahead of the film's October release.

Kpop Demon Hunters' Arden Cho wants to collaborate with BTS, BLACKPINK: ExclusiveNetflix's 'KPop Demon Hunters' has captured global audiences with its hit song 'Golden' becoming the top-streamed track. Actor Arden Cho discussed her role, Asian-American representation, and hoped for a sequel in an exclusive interview.

Farah Khan unveils Aunty Kisko Bola teaser, Sajid-Ssunita join as judgesFarah Khan has launched a quirky YouTube talent show titled 'Aunty Kisko Bola', dedicated to showcasing women's talents regardless of age. The show will feature rotating guest judges, starting with Sajid Khan and Ssunita Ahuja.

Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce enjoy college football in 1st outing after engagementTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce made their first public appearance after announcing their engagement. Several viral pictures and videos showed the singer flaunting her sparkling diamond ring.

Govinda, Ssunita dance together at Ganesh Visarjan amid divorce rumours. VideosActor Govinda and his wife Ssunita Ahuja ended divorce rumours by celebrating Ganesh Chaturthi with their family, performing the visarjan rituals with son Yashvardhan. Ssunita also addressed the media, firmly dismissing the speculation and reaffirming their bond.

Salman Khan dances to dhol at Ganpati visarjan, Sonakshi-Zaheer join. WatchSalman Khan participated in Ganpati visarjan by shaking a leg at the grand festivities, which were held by his sister, Arpita Khan Sharma. A video of the superstar dancing to dhol has emerged online.

The Thursday Murder Club review: Immersive whodunnit defying ageing stereotypesRelease Date:Thu Aug 28, 2025The Thursday Murder Club review: 'The Thursday Murder Club', a classic whodunnit blended with humour, is about veteran sleuths investigating unsolved mysteries. The film is an homage to Agatha Christie and Alfred Hitchcock. Is the mystery-comedy worth your time? Here is our review.

Ranveer Singh lights up Ganpati bash as he dances to Deva Shree Ganesha songRanveer Singh danced to 'Deva Shree Ganesha' song at the Ganpati festivities at Ambani residence, Antilia. Deepika Padukone accompanied him to the event.

general news.headline: Trump taking out his grudge on India, says JefferiesThe report by Jefferies said Trump's 'personal pique' saw the US impose a 50% tariff on India, the highest among American trading partners.

Jio IPO likely to make Dalal Street debut by 1st half of 2026Jio IPO: The announcement was made by Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani in his address to investors at the conglomerate's 48th Annual General Meeting (AGM).

Rahul Gandhi must apologise: Amit Shah on abuse to PM, his mother at Bihar RallyAmit Shah condemned Congress leaders for allegedly using derogatory words against PM Modi and his late mother during a Bihar rally, calling it the "greatest fall in politics."

US cops shoot dead Sikh man performing gatka on road, release footageLos Angeles police claimed that Gurpreet Singh was wielding a machete and was shot dead after he refused to comply and tried to attack the cops.

How a poor Persian oilman's son rose to rule Kohinoor's nest in IndiaThe rock that Taylor Swift flaunted after her engagement brought India's Golconda diamond mines into focus. The Koh-i-Noor, the world's most famous and costliest diamond, was from India's Golconda mines, and was looted and taken to Persia by invader Nadir Shah. About 150 years before that, a Persian oilman's son, Mir Jumla, who helped Aurangzeb in his succession battle, came to rule the Golconda mines, the nest of the Kohinoor.

Thai court sacks suspended PM Shinawatra over leaked call with Cambodian leaderPaetongtarn Shinawatra, who was Thailand's youngest prime minister, becomes the sixth premier from or backed by the billionaire Shinawatra family to be removed by the military or judiciary in a tumultuous two-decade battle for power between the country's warring elites.

Asia Cup 2025: India likely to play without jersey sponsor, say sourcesIndia are likely to play without any jersey sponsor in the Asia Cup 2025, sources have confirmed to India Today. During the BCCI emergency Apex council meeting, there were discussions about bringing in the new sponsor. But since there is not enough time to advertise and complete the process, it is going to be a tough task for the board.

US Treasury Secretary mocks Indian rupee, says it can't beat dollarUS Treasury Secretary Scott Bessant said he is not concerned about the rupee becoming a reserve currency, adding that it cannot rival the dollar as it remains at an all-time low. Earlier, US President Donald Trump had dismissed India's economy as "dead". However, economists argue that US tariffs and distancing India could backfire on America itself.

Param Sundari review: Sidharth-Janhvi can sell Kerala trips, not loveRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025'Param Sundari' review: Tushar Jalota's romantic comedy starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor delivers stunning Kerala visuals and good music, but lacks chemistry and a compelling story. Yet another predictable and forgettable Bollywood love story.

Over 250 flights hit as rain pounds Delhi-NCR, big jams as roads waterloggedHeavy traffic congestion was reported across several key routes in the capital following a spell of rain. Major stretches, including the DND Flyway, Mathura Road, Vikas Marg, ISBT, Geeta Colony and Rajaram Kohli Marg experienced slow-moving traffic.

Nepal denies reports of Jaish terrorists entering Bihar: They flew to MalaysiaNepal stated that the three Pakistani nationals flew from Kathmandu to Kuala Lumpur on separate flights at different times, contradicting Bihar Police's claim that they had entered the poll-bound state.

Battle of Patna ft flagpoles: Congress, BJP workers get into street-fightBoth parties accused each other of instigating the clash. BJP workers told India Today TV that they were holding a peaceful protest in front of the Congress office in Patna before people allegedly started pelting stones. On the other hand, Congress accused BJP workers of throwing stones from outside.

How Trump's gold fixation is bringing Midas curse to White HouseDonald Trump has brought the golden flashiness of his Trump Towers to the White House, changing its look and feel. The whole world now knows about Trump's gold obsession and Apple's Tim Cook has even "bribed" him with a golden plaque. This is how the Midas curse is bringing a golden murkiness to the White House.

What is Daruma Doll gifted to PM Modi, what's its significance?During his two-day visit to Japan for the India-Japan Annual Summit, Prime Minister Narendra Modi was presented with a Daruma doll by the chief priest of Shorinzan-Daruma-ji Temple. The Daruma doll is a hollow, round, brightly painted figure with blank white eyes. It symbolises perseverance, resilience, good fortune, and the pursuit of goals.

World not only watching but counting on India: PM Modi in Tokyo Live UpdatesThe two sides will go beyond signing MoUs, with Prime Minister Modi and his Japanese counterpart expected to deliberate on the prevailing geopolitical and geo-economic landscape amid US President Donald Trump's ongoing trade war, Indian envoy to Japan Sibi George said.

Video: Rajasthan driver passes steering to helper, collapses, then diesIn the CCTV footage accessed by India Today TV, Rao can be seen seated next to his colleague before collapsing. A woman in the front seat is seen calling for help as other passengers rush to support him, holding him upright and rubbing his feet.

How to recognise a panic attack in public, and help someone through itAt a time when cases of anxiety and panic attacks are on the rise, it's important to know how to support someone in distress. Here's a quick guide.

Xi's secret letter spurred Delhi-Beijing thaw during Trump's tariff war: ReportIn his letter to President Droupadi Murmu, later passed on to PM Modi, Chinese President Xi Jinping sought to "test the waters on improving ties." Indian officials said Xi reached out directly to Indian President Droupadi Murmu in March, during heightened US trade tensions with China.

Video: Punjab ministers discuss Sweden, Goa cruise trips during flood inspectionA leaked Facebook Live showing three Punjab ministers recalling cruises and beach trips during a flood survey in Tarn Taran has triggered outrage, with Congress accusing the AAP government of insensitivity amid the flood alert.

Anchored by powerful performances and soulful music, the film is a poignant ode to resilience and art.

Unseen video of Harbhajan slapping Sreesanth out; Lalit Modi's clip goes viralFormer IPL chairman Lalit Modi has released the long-hidden clip of Harbhajan Singh slapping Sreesanth during an IPL match in 2008. The footage has gone viral ever since it played on Michael Clarke's podcast.

Degrees don't pay rent: White-collar dreams, blue-collar jobsMany Indian students face low-skilled survival jobs despite expensive foreign education. This exposes systemic failures and the gap between expectations and reality abroad.

Twice the size of Qutub Minar: New Starship to tower over skyscrapersThis next-generation rocket is designed not only for size but also for power; Starship V4 will feature 42 Raptor engines, three more than previous versions, enabling even greater thrust and payload capacity.

Rupee falls to all-time low of 87.97 amid US tariff concernsA weaker rupee against the yuan could offer a partial cushion for exporters hit by US tariffs, making Indian products relatively cheaper compared to Chinese rivals. It could also help narrow India's trade deficit with China.

sports.headline: World Championships: Tanisha Crasto and Dhruv Kapila fall short of historic medalBWF World Championships 2025: India's Dhruv Kapila and Tanisha Crasto fell one step short of a historic medal at the world meet. The 17th-ranked pair los to World No. 4 Chen Tangjie and Toh Eewei of Malaysia on Friday in Paris.

Watch: Coco Gauff meets gymnastics legend Simone Biles at US OpenAmerican star Coco Gauff thanked her inspiration, decorated US gymnast Simone Biles, when they met at Arthur Ashe Stadium on Thursday, after the tennis star defeated Donna Vekic 7-6(5), 6-2 in the second round of the 2025 US Open.

Asia Cup 2025: Champions Korea hammer Chinese Taipei, Malaysia and Japan winChampions South Korea started their Asia Cup title defence with a bang as they swept aside Chinese Taipei. Japan breezed past Kazakhstan and Malaysia overcame an early wobble to defeat Bangladesh.

Kohli or MS Dhoni, who played bouncer better? Neil Wagner recalls fiery spellPacer Neil Wagner has reflected on the 2014 Auckland Test, noting that he found MS Dhoni more comfortable against pace than Virat Kohli in overseas conditions. Wagner used the short ball plan to perfection to help his team win the first Test by 40 runs.

Women's World Cup: Sciver-Brunt calls Kate Cross omission 'bitter but positive'England captain Nat Sciver-Brunt has said that Kate Cross's exclusion from the Women's World Cup squad reflects a team moving in the right direction. She acknowledged that selecting a squad for any tournament is always a tough and significant decision.

Novak Djokovic, Carlos Alcaraz headline high-octane third-round actionUS Open 2025, August 29: Day six of the tournament promises high-octane action as third-round matches feature some of the sport's biggest stars. World No. 2 Carlos Alcaraz will take on Italy's Luciano Darderi, while Novak Djokovic returns to Centre Court to face Cameron Norrie.

During the BCCI emergency Apex council meeting, there were discussions about bringing in the new sponsor. But since there is not enough time to advertise and complete the process, it is going to be a tough task for the board.

WWE Raw implements bold time shift to challenge NFL primetime viewershipWWE Raw teams with Netflix for a bold September test run, starting at 7 p.m. ET to get ahead of Monday Night Football's prime time surge.

BGMI Showdown 2025 announced by Krafton India; winner to secure PMGC 2025 spotBGMI Showdown 2025, teased by Krafton India, will be the company's third official tournament in the country with a huge prize pool. The winning team will advance to PMGC.

Duleep Trophy: Shami fails to impress on first class return, leaks 100 runs in 23 oversIndia fast bowler Mohammed Shami had a forgettable return to red-ball cricket as he leaked 100 runs in 23 overs, playing for East Zone vs North Zone in the Duleep Trophy quarter-final.

Riot Games launches Leagues Disrupt Festival with NLC 2025 finals in StockholmRiot Games is launching Leagues Disrupt, a new esports and gaming festival in Stockholm. The event will feature the NLC 2025 finals and a wide range of entertainment, boosting esports culture in the Nordics.

Sindhu reveals mantra for World Championships after stunning win: Not much to proveTwo-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu revealed her mantra for the World Badminton Championships after stunning world number two Wang Zhi Yi of China to storm into the quarter-finals on Thursday.

US Open: Tsitsipas' father warned for coaching from sidelines during 2nd round clashStefanos Tsitsipas' father, Apostolos Tsitsipas, was warned for coaching his son from the sidelines during the second round match of the US Open 2025 against Daniel Altmaier.

Lyles and Alfred dominate Diamond League Final in ZurichAmerican sprinter Noah Lyles became the first track athlete to win six Diamond League Final titles by defeating Botswana's Letsile Tebogo in the 200 metres, while St Lucia's Julien Alfred put injury concerns behind her with a commanding victory in the women's 100m.

Meanwhile, Amanda Anisimova and Alex de Minaur cruised into the third round with convincing straight-set victories.

R Ashwin breaks silence on IPL retirement, reveals overseas leagues plansFormer India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has opened up on his sudden retirement from the Indian Premier League (IPL) and revealed his aspirations to play in foreign leagues.

Chelsea agrees deal with Manchester United to sign Alejandro Garnacho: ReportManchester United have agreed a £40 million ($54 million) deal to sell Argentine winger Alejandro Garnacho to Chelsea, according to a source close to the club on Thursday.

Naomi Osaka condemns Jelena Ostapenko over heated US Open row with TownsendNaomi Osaka condemned the use of terms like "no education" and "no class" against a Black tennis player, calling them among the worst things to say, as the row between Taylor Townsend and Jelena Ostapenko sparked fierce debate at the US Open on Thursday.

Diamond League Final: Rare off-day for Neeraj as fans reminded how high the bar isNeeraj Chopra was comfortably outclassed by Julian Weber in the Diamond League Final on Thursday. A rare stumble for a relentless champion, he still reminds fans why they expect nothing less than greatness.

US Open 2025: Zverev breezes past Fearnley, Gauff downs Vekic to reach round 3Alexander Zverev made his way into the third round of the US Open 2025 men's singles, while Coco Gauff also progressed ahead, beating Donna Vekic. Zverev beat Jacob Fearnley in straight sets while Gauff had to recover from numerous service errors.

National Sports Day 2025: India honours Major Dhyan Chand as Hockey Asia Cup beginsIndia celebrates National Sports Day on August 29, in honour of hockey legend Major Dhyan Chand. This year, the day coincides with the start of the Men's Hockey Asia Cup 2025 in Rajgir, Bihar.

India chase World Cup ticket as Rajgir ready for hockey's grand returnHockey returns to Rajgir once again as India look to use most of their last chance and secure their spot at next year's World Cup by winning the Asia Cup 2025. India, despite their Asian dominance, will be wary of the threat posed by the other sides.

Lionel Messi hints at emotional home farewell in September World Cup qualifierLionel Messi has hinted that Argentina's World Cup qualifier against Venezuela on September 4 in Buenos Aires could be his final home game, signaling the approaching end of a legendary international career fans hoped would never close.

Jannik Sinner breezes past Alex Popyrin, Iga Swiatek takes down LamensDefending champion Jannik Sinner dominates Alex Popyrin in straight sets to reach the US Open third round. Iga Swiatek and Naomi Osaka also advance, setting up high-stakes clashes as the tournament heads into its second week.

PSG handed toughest Champions League draw, Real Madrid and Liverpool face tough testThe 2025/26 UEFA Champions League draw pits PSG against Bayern, Chelsea, Arsenal, and more in a tough group, while Bayern face Chelsea and PSG. Real Madrid take on Manchester City, Liverpool, Juventus, and other heavyweights, promising a thrilling season opener.

Satwik and Chirag storm into quarters on dream day for Indian shuttlersBWF World Championships: Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty outclassed higher-ranked Liang Wei Keng and Wang Chang of China 19-21, 21-15, 21-17 to book a place in the quarterfinals. Earlier in the day, PV Sindhu and the mixed doubles duo of Dhruv Kapila and Tanisha Crasto also made it to the last-eight in Paris.

Diamond League Final: Neeraj extends 4-year streak, but red-hot Weber wins crownNeeraj Chopra salvaged second place in Zurich with a last-throw effort, but Julian Weber's dominance left the Indian ace chasing shadows. With the World Championships looming, the stage is set for a high-voltage showdown next month.

Who is Danish Malewar? 21-year-old Vidarbha star continues to shine in Duleep TrophyDanish Malewar's unbeaten 198 on Duleep Trophy debut continues his meteoric rise in Indian domestic cricket. From Vidarbha's Ranji hero to Central Zone's mainstay, the 21-year-old is fast emerging as a serious contender for India's Test batting future.

Diamond League Highlights: Julian Weber wins with 91.51m throw, Neeraj Chopra finishes 2ndDiamond League Final Highlights: Julian Weber took the win with a world lead throw of 91.37m on his very first chance, and bested it with a 91.51m in his second. Meanwhile, Neeraj is scraped the 2nd position with his final throw, resulting in 85.01m.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
